items.title: Nintendo’s Switch 2 era comes at a price
items.author: Jay Peters
items.summary:
- The Nintendo Switch 2 is more expensive than the original Switch, launching at $449.99.
- Pre-orders in the US start on April 9th, 2024.
- Upcoming games for the Switch 2 are priced between $69.99 and $79.99, with notable titles like *Donkey Kong Bananza* and *Mario Kart World*.
- Accessories for the Switch 2 include Joy-Con 2 at $89.99 and Pro Controller at $79.99.
- Pricing for some games includes *The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom* at $79.00.
- Potential price increases could occur due to tariffs announced by President Trump.

items.title: Hyundai's Ioniq 6 redesign is a little sportier and a bit weirder
items.author: Umar Shakir
items.summary:
- The 2026 Ioniq 6 features a redesigned front with squintier daytime running lights and lower headlights.
- The design aims to enhance aerodynamics, compared to the original model resembling an Apple Magic Mouse.
- Hyundai emphasizes 'Pure flow, Refined' in its design philosophy for the new model.
- A performance-oriented N version will also be introduced, inspired by the RN22e concept, to be fully revealed in July.

items.title: OpenAI and Anthropic are fighting over college students with free AI
items.author: Kylie Robison
items.summary:
- OpenAI and Anthropic announced major initiatives in higher education, with Anthropic announcing Claude for Education on Wednesday, followed by OpenAI’s similar announcement on Thursday.
- Anthropic's new feature, Learning mode, uses Socratic questioning to enhance student critical thinking rather than just providing answers.
- OpenAI’s ChatGPT Edu, launched in May 2024, is now free for U.S. and Canadian college students until May, offering features like large file uploads and Deep Research.

items.title: Trump’s tariff plan includes a potential death blow to cheap Chinese e-commerce
items.author: Mia Sato
items.summary:
- President Trump’s new tariff plan increases costs for US consumers purchasing low-value packages from China.
- The de minimis exemption, allowing packages under $800 to enter the US duty-free, has been paused since February 2024.
- An executive order effective May 2 will impose a 30% fee or $25 charge on packages under $800 sent through USPS.
- Other package delivery methods will face all previous duties, potentially increasing costs significantly.
- The implementation of this tariff structure raises concerns about processing capacity for the millions of packages entering the US daily.

items.title: Rural fiber internet expansion is at risk as Trump administration holds funds
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary:
- Fiber internet providers worry about the Biden administration's promised funds not materializing for rural internet service.
- Cajun Broadband was granted $33 million, but funds are not flowing amidst concerns over a potential preference for satellite services like Starlink.
- The BEAD program, with a total of $42.45 billion allocated, is facing leadership changes and potential policy overhauls under Trump-appointed officials.
- Many states have started projects relying on BEAD funds, with implications that a shift away from fiber could waste millions in private investments and lead to slower, more expensive internet for residents over time.

items.title: Nvidia confirms the Nintendo Switch 2 has DLSS and real-time ray tracing
items.author: Jay Peters
items.summary:
- Nvidia confirms that the Nintendo Switch 2 includes support for DLSS, allowing for upscaled gaming and improved performance.
- The Switch 2 will feature real-time ray tracing with dedicated RT Cores and Tensor Cores for enhanced graphics and AI functionalities.
- The console promises 10x the graphics performance of the original Nintendo Switch and implements Nvidia G-Sync technology for improved refresh rates in handheld mode.
- Nintendo has aimed to significantly upgrade the power of the Switch in its new version, facilitating new features in games like Donkey Kong and Mario Kart.
- The Nintendo Switch 2 is set to launch on June 5th with a starting price of $449.99.

items.title: M3gan 2.0 gives the doll some upgrades in new trailer
items.author: Charles Pulliam-Moore
items.summary:
- The sequel to Blumhouse’s first M3gan feature, M3gan 2.0, appears to exceed its predecessor in excitement and humor.
- The story takes place a few years after the first film, focusing on Gemma and her niece Cady, survivors of M3gan's rampage.
- Gemma, now advocating for AI regulations, faces a new threat from a defense contractor's advanced robot, Amelia, forcing her to revive M3gan for a showdown.
- The trailer showcases a campy tone, featuring M3gan in a wingsuit to the tune of “Oops!... I Did It Again.”
- M3gan 2.0 is scheduled to be released in theaters on June 27th.

items.title: Everything we know so far about the Nintendo Switch 2
items.author: Ash Parrish
items.summary:
- Nintendo reveals details about the new Nintendo Switch 2, including a custom Nvidia processor enabling DLSS and ray tracing.
- Key games showcased include *Donkey Kong Bananza*, which is celebrated as the standout title from hands-on previews.
- Switch 2 features mouse-like controls and ambitious new social features like voice and video chat through the new "C" button.
- Launch date set for June 5th at a price of $449.99.
- Notable game releases announced with preorders becoming available soon, including *Mario Kart World* and *Hyrule Warriors: Age of Imprisonment*.
- The device will support GameCube games as part of Nintendo Switch Online, starting with titles such as *The Legend of Zelda: The Wind Waker* and *F-Zero GX*.

items.title: Trump’s tariffs are ‘a debacle of epic proportions’ for the auto industry
items.author: Andrew J. Hawkins
items.summary:
- President Trump’s 25% tariffs on imported vehicles have taken effect, causing panic in the auto industry.
- Analysts predict price hikes of $5,000 to $10,000 on new cars, complicating the already challenging affordability for consumers.
- The tariffs will disrupt a complex supply chain, raising manufacturing costs significantly, especially for battery-electric crossover SUVs.
- Many affordable cars are produced outside the US, meaning the tariffs will hit consumers hardest in the budget segment.
- Consumers are experiencing financial stress with extended loans, and panic shopping is rising as people rush to buy cars before prices increase.
- Automakers are responding with discounts and temporary layoffs to manage the fallout from the tariffs.
- The Trump administration is exploring tax breaks and deregulation as potential relief measures for car buyers.

items.title: This ’90s-esque social media site only works for three hours a day
items.author: Victoria Song
items.summary:
- Seven39 is an experimental social media site open from 7:39 PM to 10:39 PM ET daily.
- It features a chronological feed with a 200-character limit and no ads.
- The site aims to recreate a nostalgic, less overwhelming online social experience.
- Users engage through posts, replies, and likes, with a small community of around 3,000 members.
- The platform lacks certain modern features and depends on user involvement for growth.
- Content moderation and sustainability of the project are ongoing concerns for the creator, Mark Lyons.

items.title: YouTube is updating Shorts with TikTok-like editing features
items.author: Jess Weatherbed
items.summary:
- YouTube introduces new editing features for Shorts aimed at enhancing creator experience with short-form videos.
- Five new tools include a revamped video editor, allowing cutting, rearranging clips, zooming, and adding text/music; expected to launch this spring.
- Creators can synchronize their video clips with chosen music tracks and utilize video filters/overlays for viral trends.
- Later this spring, users will also be able to add image stickers and AI-generated stickers for customization.
- This update follows previous features like robotic voiceovers and updated view counting.
- The announcement aligns with the approaching deadline for TikTok to secure a US buyer, potentially shifting creators to YouTube for its familiar features.

items.title: Democrats demand probe into DOGE's alleged mishandling of personal data
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary:
- Democrats request an investigation into DOGE employee Marko Elez's access to sensitive data by the Treasury Department and GSA watchdogs.
- The inquiry follows allegations of Elez's unauthorized disclosure of a spreadsheet containing personal information.
- Elez had inappropriate access to Treasury payment systems, and previously resigned due to offensive social media posts but was later reinstated.
- Concerns highlighted about potential violations of the Privacy Act of 1974 regarding the handling of personal data.
- Investigations will also look into how many individuals were affected and the consent surrounding the data disclosure.

items.title: Donkey Kong Bananza was best in show at the Switch 2 hands-on
items.author: Ash Parrish

items.title: What AI anime memes tell us about the future of art and humanity
items.author: Nilay Patel
items.summary:
- Discussion on the impact of AI in art and the controversy it has stirred, particularly with Studio Ghibli-style memes.
- OpenAI’s image generator has sparked a debate about copyright and the ethics of AI-generated art.
- The conversation emphasizes the need to consider the balance between creativity and the potential threat to artists' livelihoods.

items.title: Twelve South’s 3-in-1 HiRise 3 Deluxe charging stand is cheaper than ever
items.author: Sheena Vasani
items.summary:
- The Twelve South HiRise 3 Deluxe charging stand is currently priced at $99.99, down from $149.99.
- The 3-in-1 charger provides 15 watts of power, able to charge an iPhone, AirPods, and an Apple Watch simultaneously.
- The design is compact, with charging pads arranged in a front-to-back line to save space.
- It supports iOS 17’s StandBy Mode, enabling the iPhone to act as a small smart display.
- Adjustable MagSafe pad offers 35 degrees of viewing angle flexibility.

items.title: Trump’s new tariff math looks a lot like ChatGPT’s
items.author: Dominic Preston
items.summary:
- President Trump announced a 10% baseline tariff on all imports into the US, including from uninhabited islands, leading to confusion and negative reactions.
- The tariff calculations reportedly mirror a simplified formula recommended by several major AI chatbots, dividing a country's trade deficit by total exports to the US and halving it for a 'discounted reciprocal tariff.'
- Stock markets dropped sharply due to the announcement, and consumers are bracing for price increases.
- The White House published its own calculation method in response to critiques but resembles the aforementioned AI-recommended formula, sparking debate on its validity and consequences for global trade starting April 5th.

items.title: Indie studio Heart Machine is experimenting with Patreon because ‘money is tough to come by’
items.author: Jay Peters
items.summary:
- Heart Machine launched a [Patreon](https://www.patreon.com/c/HeartMachineHQ/home) in December to help with revenue and community building.
- The studio faces financial challenges and has previously dealt with layoffs.
- Founder Alx Preston emphasizes the importance of connecting with audiences and adapting to industry changes.
- Patreon currently has around 230 paid members out of approximately 700 total members.
- Heart Machine's new game, *Possessor(s)*, is scheduled for release this year, while *Hyper Light Breaker* is in early access. 
- Other indie developers, like [Freehold Games](https://www.patreon.com/freeholdgames), are also using Patreon to navigate funding challenges.

items.title: Star Trek: Strange New Worlds sets phasers to kitsch in new season 3 trailer
items.author: Charles Pulliam-Moore
items.summary:
- The season three trailer of *Star Trek: Strange New Worlds* emphasizes a whimsical tone.
- The crew of the USS *Enterprise* finds themselves caught in a kitschy sci-fi program.
- Key characters include Captain Kirk (Paul Wesley), Lt. Erica Ortegas (Melissa Navia), and Una Chin-Riley (Rebecca Romijn).
- This season will feature a mix of comedy and adventure, including a *Clue*-style mystery and retro analog technology.
- The premiere date for season three is set for summer 2024 without a specific date announced yet.

items.title: Apple experiences its largest stock plunge in five years due to Trump’s tariffs
items.author: Todd Haselton
items.summary:
- Apple shares fell approximately 9% on Thursday, marking the largest decline in five years amid new tariffs from President Trump.
- The tariffs include a 54% duty starting April 9th on imports from China, significantly impacting Apple and Amazon, which rely on overseas manufacturing.
- Other tech stocks, such as Nvidia and Tesla, also experienced declines, with Nvidia down over 4% and Tesla giving back Wednesday's gains.

items.title: Nikon upgraded its entry-level full-frame camera with better autofocus and faster shooting
items.author: Andrew Liszewski
items.summary:
- Nikon updates its Z5 camera to Z5 II with improved autofocus, image stabilization, and a brighter electronic viewfinder.
- New Z5 II captures video in 12-bit N-RAW format directly to SD cards.
- Pricing starts at $1,699.95 for the body, available from April 2025.
- Features a 24MP full-frame sensor, 14 fps shooting with mechanical shutter, and up to 30 fps with electronic shutter.
- Pre-release capture mode records images before the shutter is pressed, aiding burst shooting.
- Video capabilities include 4K at 60 fps and 1080p at 120 fps.
- Advanced 3D tracking autofocus detects various subjects.
- New Picture Control button allows access to 31 color presets and user-uploaded recipes.
- The viewfinder brightness reaches 3,000 nits, and the LCD touchscreen can rotate for better angles.

items.title: Microsoft’s miniature Windows 365 Link PC is available to buy now
Nintendo Switch 2 hands-on: it’s all in the games
items.author: Andrew Webster
items.summary: - The Nintendo Switch 2 features a 7.9-inch LCD display, larger than the original Switch’s 6.2 inches. - Enhanced performance evident in games like Mario Kart World and Donkey Kong Bananza, showcasing larger and more intricate game environments. - Supports new Joy-Con controllers with mouse-like functionality for improved gameplay experience, notably in Metroid Prime 4: Beyond. - Minor upgrades such as improved HD Rumble are introduced, enhancing the tactile feedback. - Initial game lineup illustrates the potential of the new hardware, despite being a slightly refined version of the original console.

items.title: Mario Kart World is pure chaos
items.author: Andrew Webster
items.summary:
- New game introduces chaotic gameplay without a single standout feature.
- Races start with karts already in motion, adding to the fast-paced experience.
- Tracks are larger with more obstacles, including moving giraffes, ostriches, and various enemies.
- New navigation features allow driving on water and grinding on rails.
- Races can host up to 24 drivers simultaneously, enhancing the competition.
- New “knockout tour” mode introduces a battle royale-style competition.
- Detailed visuals enhance the gameplay experience, from characters to environmental effects.
- Scheduled to launch on June 5th, alongside the Nintendo Switch.

items.title: The Nintendo GameCube still rules
items.author: Andrew Webster
items.summary: - GameCube games are set to arrive on the Nintendo Switch 2 for Nintendo Online subscribers, initially featuring titles like The Legend of Zelda: The Wind Waker, Soulcalibur II, and F-Zero GX. - F-Zero is a classic futuristic racing game, with its last main console release being F-Zero GX in 2003. - Playing F-Zero GX on the Switch 2 revealed its timeless graphics and smooth gameplay, enhanced by a new wireless version of the GameCube controller releasing with the console on June 5th. - The GameCube, while not Nintendo's best-selling console, featured a unique lineup of games with a lasting fan base, which will now be accessible to a broader audience via the Switch 2.

items.title: I’m not sold on the Switch 2’s mouse-like controls
items.author: Ash Parrish
items.summary:
- The Nintendo Switch 2 features new Joy-Con controllers with mouse functionality.
- Hands-on testing revealed discomfort while using the controllers in mouse mode.
- Games tested included Drag x Drive and Metroid Prime 4: Beyond, both of which struggled with precision controls via the mouse feature.
- The Joy-Con configuration forces unnatural wrist and hand positions, leading to fatigue.
- Despite a seamless transition between mouse and normal modes in Metroid Prime 4, the aiming felt imprecise and unsatisfactory.
- The author expresses doubt about the practicality and comfort of mouse controls, stating they feel awkward and painful to use.

items.title: Universities are giving up the fight for free speech — students aren’t
items.author: Gaby Del Valle
items.summary:
- Elite universities are complying with Trump administration demands to avoid loss of federal funding.
- The administration has threatened funding cuts if universities support diversity programs or do not suppress protests.
- Columbia University lost $400 million in funding over transgender policies and is under scrutiny for its handling of protests and faculty.
- Ongoing investigations into Title VI violations are targeting universities promoting racial diversity hiring practices.
- Lawsuits have emerged challenging the administration's actions as violations of the First Amendment.
- ICE has arrested students involved in pro-Palestine activism, creating a climate of fear on campuses.
- Some universities are instructing staff not to intervene in ICE activities, raising concerns over student protections.
- A coalition of right-wing groups is supporting the administration's anti-DEI efforts.

items.title: Verizon now offers a three-year price lock — but there’s a catch
items.author: Allison Johnson
items.summary:
- Verizon announces a three-year price lock for certain plans, applicable to new and existing customers.
- Price lock covers only the base charge; fees and taxes can still increase.
- Customers must be on a myPlan subscription to qualify for the price lock.
- New offers include a free phone with trade-in for old devices, also requiring a myPlan subscription.
- Customers should carefully review the fine print to understand the conditions of the offers.

items.title: AV1 is supposed to make streaming better, so why isn’t everyone using it?
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary:
- AV1 was developed in 2015 by tech giants like Netflix, Google, and Amazon to improve video streaming efficiency.
- The codec offers around 30% better coding efficiency compared to H.265 and VP9, and is royalty-free.
- Despite its advantages, major platforms like Max and Paramount Plus have yet to adopt AV1.
- AV1 has seen use on platforms like YouTube and Netflix since its debut, with notable support in 4K and 8K streaming.
- Hardware support is a challenge, as devices need to support AV1 either through dedicated hardware or resource-intensive software solutions.
- Various companies like Apple and Nvidia have introduced devices with AV1 compatibility, but adoption remains inconsistent across the industry.
- AOMedia states that about 95% of Netflix’s content is encoded with AV1, while only 50% of YouTube videos use it.
- Newer codecs like VVC offer greater compression but are not royalty-free, contrasting with AV1’s current standing.
- Concerns persist about the efficiency trade-offs in encoding and potential licensing complexities in AV1’s future.

items.title: Google's NotebookLM can now find its own sources
items.author: Jess Weatherbed
items.summary:
- Google introduced a new feature in NotebookLM that allows the AI tool to find its own web sources for summarization.
- The 'Discover' feature started rolling out on Wednesday and is expected to reach all users within a week.
- NotebookLM can analyze hundreds of web sources in seconds and provide up to ten relevant recommendations.
- Users can select sources for use in various features, including FAQs, Briefing Docs, and podcast-style Audio Overviews.
- The 'I’m Feeling Curious' button prompts NotebookLM to generate random sources for exploration.

items.title: Amazon is ready to launch its Starlink competitor
items.author: Thomas Ricker
items.summary:
- First batch of 27 Project Kuiper satellites scheduled to launch next week.
- Launch set for April 9th at 12pm ET from Cape Canaveral Space Force Station, using an Atlas V rocket.
- Amazon plans to offer high-speed internet service later this year, with speeds up to 100Mbps on a 7-inch terminal.
- Larger dishes for residential use can reach speeds of 1Gbps, expected to be priced under $400 each.
- Amazon's satellite system will have over 3,200 LEO satellites, orbiting at 17,000 mph.
- Satellites feature a unique coating to reduce visibility to ground-based astronomers.
- This mission marks a significant test with many satellites being deployed at once, providing a learning opportunity for future launches.

items.title: What will the Switch 2 cost after the Trump tariffs?
items.author: Dominic Preston
items.summary:
- Nintendo revealed its Switch 2 just as Trump announced new tariffs.  
- New tariffs of up to 49% could affect prices for US consumers.  
- From previously relying on China, Nintendo diversified manufacturing to Vietnam and Cambodia.  
- Research shows consumers often bear the cost of tariffs.  
- Switch 2 launches on June 5th at $449.99; tariffs could raise the price to around $630.  
- Nintendo may have anticipated tariffs and stocked up consoles in the US.  
- Tariff changes are uncertain, and may be delayed or altered before impacting prices.

items.title: Can I interest you in an app that tracks your driving behavior?
items.author: Andrew J. Hawkins
items.summary:
- Research by the AAA Foundation for Traffic Safety indicates that smartphone apps can enhance road safety by monitoring driving behavior.
- Utilizing feedback from these apps leads to reductions in speeding (13%), hard braking (21%), and rapid acceleration (25%).
- Over a 12-week study, participants improved driving habits with sustained positive changes seen even after the monitoring ended.

items.title: The Nintendo GameCube is about to get its due
items.author: Wes Davis
items.summary:
- Nintendo announced that classic GameCube games will be available on the Nintendo Switch Online (NSO) service, now termed "Nintendo Classics."
- Launch titles for the Nintendo Switch 2 will include “The Legend of Zelda: The Wind Waker” and “F-Zero GX”.
- Preorders for the Switch 2 will prioritize long-time NSO subscribers.
- Other GameCube re-releases mentioned include “Super Mario Strikers” and “Chibi-Robo!”
- A wireless recreation of the GameCube controller will be available for gameplay.
- Despite its lower sales compared to the Wii and Switch, the GameCube is receiving renewed attention through these re-releases and NSO additions.

items.title: How the Nintendo Switch 2 compares to prior models on paper
items.author: Sheena Vasani
items.summary:
- The Nintendo Switch 2 is priced at $449.99 and will release on June 5th, 2025.
- Features a 7.9-inch 1080p LCD display, larger than previous models.
- Comes with 256GB internal storage and can expand via microSD Express cards (up to 2TB).
- New GameChat feature for voice calls, screen sharing, and video chatting.
- Improved CPU and GPU performance with 4K gameplay at up to 60fps when docked.
- Battery life varies: 2.5 to 6.5 hours for Switch 2, while previous models last 4.5 to 9 hours.
- New Joy-Con design with magnetic connection and enhanced durability.
- Launch titles include games like *Mario Kart World* and *The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom*, as well as backward compatibility with most original Switch games.

items.title: NaNoWriMo Organization Announces Closure After 20 Years
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary:
- NaNoWriMo is shutting down after more than 20 years due to financial struggles.
- The organization began in 1999 with 21 writers and became a nonprofit in 2006.
- Over 400,000 writers participated in 2022's programs.
- In 2023, many writers left due to the organization's stance on AI in writing and issues regarding a moderator.
- Participation and fundraising have declined in recent years; the site will remain online but stop hosting challenges.
- The email to the community expressed that the closure represents a significant loss for writers, with hope for future opportunities.

items.title: Nintendo Switch 2 Introduces GameChat and Enhanced Online Features
items.author: Jay Peters
items.summary:
- Nintendo launched its Switch 2 Direct with the exclusive title **Mario Kart World**.
- The Direct showcased **GameChat**, a voice and video chat system for gaming friends.
- GameChat allows screen sharing; however, experienced lower framerates and sound quality issues were noted.
- An **Open-Access Period** for GameChat is available until **March 31, 2026**, without requiring Nintendo Switch Online.
- New feature **GameShare** allows multiplayer play with shared games.
- The Nintendo Switch Online app is rebranded to the **Nintendo Switch App** and offers new features including 100 recent captures and a section for **Zelda Notes**.
- The **Expansion Pack** of Nintendo Switch Online will include GameCube titles and upgraded editions of select games at no extra charge.

items.title: Donald Trump announces tariffs that could raise the price of almost everything you buy
The best ereader to buy right now
items.author: Sheena Vasani
items.summary:
- E-readers provide a book-like experience with fewer distractions and less eye strain.
- Features to look for include easy navigation, waterproofing, note-taking capabilities, and access to a wide selection of digital titles.
- The 12th-gen Kindle Paperwhite is recommended for Amazon users, priced at $159.99, with features like a 7-inch 300ppi screen and IPX8 waterproofing.
- The Kobo Libra Colour is a strong alternative for non-Amazon users, priced at $229.99, offering a color screen and physical buttons but lacks the ease of accessing Amazon's library.
- Kindle models have a proprietary format, limiting compatibility with non-Amazon ebooks, while Kobo supports EPUB files for a wider selection.
- The base-model Kindle at $109.99 is noted as the best cheap option with excellent display resolution and USB-C charging.

items.title: Thunderbird email is going pro to better compete with Gmail
items.author: Umar Shakir
items.summary:
- Thunderbird is launching paid "pro" tier services to compete with Gmail and others.
- New offerings include @thundermail.com email addresses, appointment scheduling, file sharing, and AI features.
- Users can join a beta waitlist at [thundermail.com](http://thundermail.com/).
- Announcement made by Thunderbird managing director Ryan Sipes on a planning discussion group.
- Original Thunderbird client launched in 2003; development handed off in 2012 and moved to MZLA Technology Corporation in 2020.
- Sipes stated: "It is better late than never" regarding the new services.

items.title: Apple stumbles with latest AirPods Max firmware
items.author: Chris Welch
items.summary:
- Apple announced that lossless audio and ultra low latency features were coming to AirPods Max with USB-C.
- Firmware version 7E99 was supposed to be released with iOS 18.4 and macOS Sequoia 15.4 but has been delayed.
- Apple added a 'coming soon' note for the AirPods Max firmware on their support site.
- The delay might be due to an error in the update file, requiring additional updates to iOS and macOS.
- Apple introduced a USB-C to 3.5mm cable for AirPods Max that works without the firmware update.
- The update process for AirPods is criticized as being too complex and lacking a manual trigger option.

items.title: Here are the best AirPods deals you can get right now
items.author: Sheena Vasani
items.summary:
- Discounts on Apple’s AirPods lineup are available, including AirPods Max, AirPods 4, and AirPods Pro.
- The new AirPods 4 models offer improved sound, additional comfort, and a price range of $129 for the standard and $179 for the noise-canceling version, both available with discounts.
- The latest AirPods Pro have enhanced noise cancellation and start at $199, with current offers at Amazon and Walmart.
- Deals for AirPods Max available at $529 and $494.99 for the first-gen model at Best Buy.

items.title: Automattic Lays Off 16% of Workforce to Secure Future
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary:
- Automattic, the parent company of WordPress.com, is laying off about 16% of its workers, affecting approximately 280 employees.
- The layoffs were announced in a memo from CEO Matt Mullenweg, aimed at protecting the company’s long-term future.
- Before the layoffs, Automattic had 1,777 employees, which has now been reduced to 1,495.
- Mullenweg previously offered employees $30,000 or six months of salary to voluntarily leave if they disagreed with the company’s direction regarding a dispute with WP Engine.
- The company has faced legal challenges from WP Engine after blocking them from WordPress.org's server and taking over their Advanced Custom Fields plugin.

items.title: The Nintendo Switch smartphone app is getting some excellent new features
items.author: Charles Pulliam-Moore
items.summary:
- Nintendo announced an update for the Nintendo Switch smartphone app during a Direct presentation.
- The app will allow easier transfer of screenshots and videos to phones or computers, especially for Switch 2 owners.
- Users will access the 100 most recent media directly through the app, without needing a Nintendo Switch Online membership.
- A new feature called 'Zelda Notes' will be integrated into the app, providing spoken directions and other support for 'Breath of the Wild' and 'Tears for the Kingdom'.
- The update aims to enhance the app's utility and engagement with Nintendo games.

items.title: ‘TikTok America,’ Amazon, and other rumors about who might buy TikTok
items.author: Richard Lawler
items.summary:
- President Trump pushed back a deadline for banning TikTok, set to expire on April 5th.  
- Trump plans to announce a 'TikTok America' proposal, involving 50% ownership by US investors and a 19.9% share for ByteDance.  
- Amazon and AppLovin are among the potential buyers for TikTok, aiming to capitalize on its influence and ad-targeting capabilities.  
- Uncertainty remains whether any deal can satisfy US law regarding foreign ownership of TikTok.  
- Ongoing discussions regarding tariffs and additional measures are expected from the Trump administration.

items.title: Some Nintendo Switch 2 games will be more expensive
items.author: Jay Peters
items.summary: - Nintendo announced that Switch 2 games will have higher prices than the original Switch games. - The launch title Mario Kart World will be priced at $79.99, while Donkey Kong Bananza will cost $69.99. - This follows The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom, which launched at $69.99, marking a trend towards higher game prices for Nintendo.

items.title: Sonos permanently drops the price of its Era 100 speaker and Ray soundbar
items.author: Chris Welch
items.summary:
- Sonos has permanently lowered the prices of its Era 100 smart speaker and Ray soundbar to $199 each.
- The Era 100 sees a $50 reduction from its original price of $249, while the Ray soundbar drops $80 from its $279 launch price.
- The Era 100 includes features such as stereo sound, Bluetooth audio support, and intuitive controls.
- The Ray soundbar lacks HDMI connectivity and Dolby Atmos support but is a better alternative to built-in TV speakers.
- Sonos is focused on improving its mobile app reliability and has canceled plans for a streaming video player to prioritize other products.

items.title: Verge staffers react to the Nintendo Switch 2
items.author: Verge Staff
items.summary:
- The Nintendo Switch 2 will launch on June 5th.
- Design faces criticism; it lacks vibrant colors compared to the original Switch.
- It features a new 1080p 7.9-inch screen, but not OLED.
- Joy-Con controllers have been redesigned for comfort and include magnetic attachment.
- Social features, such as voice chat, are not well-received.
- The new GameCube controller has a design flaw with the ZL button.
- The price of $449.99 is higher than expected, with pre-orders starting April 9th.
- Donkey Kong Bananza, a new game, is highlighted as a significant title.
- Nintendo is charging for the Welcome Tour app, similar to tutorials of past consuls.
- No announcements for a new Super Smash Bros. game were made during the Direct.
- GameCube titles announced for Nintendo Switch Online, enhancing retro gaming access.
- New virtual game cards announced to streamline game management.

items.title: FTC Chair Will Obey Lawful Orders from Trump Regarding Meta Antitrust Case
items.author: Lauren Feiner
items.summary:
- FTC Chair Andrew Ferguson stated he would ‘obey lawful orders’ from President Trump regarding the antitrust case against Meta.
- Ferguson spoke at a tech policy event and described the scenario as hypothetical, emphasizing the importance of enforcing laws.
- The FTC is preparing for a significant antitrust trial against Meta aimed at potentially breaking up the company.
- Trump has made moves challenging the independence of regulatory agencies, including the FTC.
- Ferguson supports Trump’s authority over independent agencies, claiming they should be accountable to elected officials.
- Following Ferguson's statements, Mark Zuckerberg was seen entering the White House, raising further questions about potential interference.

items.title: Everything You Need to Know About the Switch 2’s Joy-Cons
items.author: Wes Davis
items.summary:
- Nintendo announced the Switch 2 at its April 2nd Direct event, priced at $449.99 and set for release on June 5th.
- The new Joy-Cons are longer, black, and have new color accents, featuring an additional 'C' button for GameChat functionality.
- Joy-Con 2s connect magnetically, have improved analog sticks, and include features for mouse-like control in select games.
- The controllers will last about 20 hours on a charge and come with various accessories like charging grips and wheel attachments for games like Mario Kart World.

items.title: Here’s the Switch 2’s homescreen
items.author: Charles Pulliam-Moore
items.summary:
- Nintendo showcased the Switch 2’s homescreen during a Direct presentation.
- The homescreen retains a similar layout to the original Switch, with minor aesthetic changes.
- Users may have the option of a darker UI mode, but customization features remain unconfirmed.
- Additional details about the console's specs, preorder information, and June release date were provided.
